Uses of Class
LineSegment

    • Uses of LineSegment in <Unnamed>

      Fields in <Unnamed> declared as LineSegment 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private LineSegment Solver.itinerary
      Line segment representing the itinerary.
      Methods in <Unnamed> that return LineSegment 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private LineSegment Solver.getItinerary() 
      Methods in <Unnamed> with parameters of type LineSegment 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Point.belongsTo(LineSegment ls)
      Given a line segment, checks if the point belongs to it.
      double Point.distanceTo(LineSegment ls)
      We can calculate the distance of a point to a line if the point is located between the line segment outermost points, this is, it's x coordinate is bigger than the smallest x coordinate of the segment and it is also smaller than the largest x coordinate of the segment.
      boolean LineSegment.intersects(LineSegment ls)
      The algorithm used is a modified version of the algorithm to check the intersection between two line segments, as described on: http://moderntone.blogspot.pt/2013/02/a-simple-algorithm-to-determine-whether.html By: Tom.
      protected boolean Circle.intersects(LineSegment ls)
      The intersection is reviewed by measuring the distance between the circle and the line segment, if this distance is bigger than the radius of the circle, then there is no intersection, if it is smaller, then there is intersection and finally if it is zero the circle is collinear to the line segment.
      protected abstract boolean GeometricFigure.intersects(LineSegment ls) 
      protected boolean Rectangle.intersects(LineSegment ls)
      Checks if a rectangle intersects a line segment, using the intersection between two line segments in all of the rectangle's edges.
      protected boolean Triangle.intersects(LineSegment ls)
      Checks if a triangle intersects a line segment, using the intersection between two line segments in all of the triangle's edges.
